Rule.name: BooleanInstantiation
Rule.Description: Use Boolean.valueOf() for variable values or Boolean.TRUE and Boolean.FALSE for constant values instead of calling the Boolean() constructor directly or calling Boolean.valueOf(true) or Boolean.valueOf(false).

Rule.name: CatchError
Rule.Description: Catching Error is dangerous; it can catch exceptions such as ThreadDeath and OutOfMemoryError.

Rule.name: CatchException
Rule.Description: Catching Exception is often too broad or general. It should usually be restricted to framework or infrastructure code, rather than application code.

Rule.name: CatchNullPointerException
Rule.Description: Catching NullPointerException is never appropriate. It should be avoided in the first place with proper null checking, and it can mask underlying errors.

Rule.name: CatchRuntimeException
Rule.Description: Catching RuntimeException is often too broad or general. It should usually be restricted to framework or infrastructure code, rather than application code.

Rule.name: CatchThrowable
Rule.Description: Catching Throwable is dangerous; it can catch exceptions such as ThreadDeath and OutOfMemoryError.

Rule.name: CloneableWithoutClone
Rule.Description: A class that implements java.lang.Cloneable should define a clone() method.

Rule.name: ConstantIfExpression
Rule.Description: Checks for if statements with a constant value for the if expression, such as true, false, null, or a literal constant value.

Rule.name: ConstantTernaryExpression
Rule.Description: Checks for ternary expressions with a constant value for the boolean expression, such as true, false, null, or a literal constant value.

Rule.name: DuplicateImport
Rule.Description: Duplicate import statements are unnecessary.

Rule.name: EmptyCatchBlock
Rule.Description: In most cases, exceptions should not be caught and ignored (swallowed).

Rule.name: EmptyElseBlock
Rule.Description: Empty else blocks are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptyFinallyBlock
Rule.Description: Empty finally blocks are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptyForStatement
Rule.Description: Empty for statements are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptyIfStatement
Rule.Description: Empty if statements are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptySwitchStatement
Rule.Description: Empty switch statements are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptySynchronizedStatement
Rule.Description: Empty synchronized statements are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptyTryBlock
Rule.Description: Empty try blocks are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EmptyWhileStatement
Rule.Description: Empty while statements are confusing and serve no purpose.

Rule.name: EqualsAndHashCode
Rule.Description: If either the equals(Object) or the hashCode() methods are overridden within a class, then both must be overridden.

Rule.name: GrailsPublicControllerMethod
Rule.Description: Checks for public methods on Grails controller classes. Static methods are ignored.

Rule.name: GrailsServletContextReference
Rule.Description: Checks for references to the servletContext object from within Grails controller and taglib classes.

Rule.name: GrailsStatelessService
Rule.Description: Checks for fields on Grails service classes. Grails service classes are singletons, by default, and so they should be reentrant and typically stateless. The ignoreFieldNames property specifies one or more field names that should be ignored. The ignoreFieldTypes property specifies one or more field type names that should be ignored. Both can optionally contain wildcard characters ('*' or '?').

Rule.name: ImportFromSamePackage
Rule.Description: An import of a class that is within the same package is unnecessary.

Rule.name: ReturnFromFinallyBlock
Rule.Description: Returning from a finally block is confusing and can hide the original exception.

Rule.name: StringInstantiation
Rule.Description: Use a String literal (e.g., "...") instead of calling the corresponding String constructor (new String("..")) directly.

Rule.name: ThrowError
Rule.Description: Checks for throwing an instance of java.lang.Error.

Rule.name: ThrowException
Rule.Description: Checks for throwing an instance of java.lang.Exception.

Rule.name: ThrowExceptionFromFinallyBlock
Rule.Description: Throwing an exception from a finally block is confusing and can hide the original exception.

Rule.name: ThrowNullPointerException
Rule.Description: Checks for throwing an instance of java.lang.NullPointerException.

Rule.name: ThrowRuntimeException
Rule.Description: Checks for throwing an instance of java.lang.RuntimeException.

Rule.name: ThrowThrowable
Rule.Description: Checks for throwing an instance of java.lang.Throwable.

Rule.name: UnnecessaryGroovyImport
Rule.Description: A Groovy file does not need to include an import for classes from java.lang, java.util, java.io, java.net, groovy.lang and groovy.util, as well as the classes java.math.BigDecimal and java.math.BigInteger.

Rule.name: UnnecessaryTernaryExpression
Rule.Description: Checks for ternary expressions where the conditional expression always evaluates to a boolean and the true and false expressions are merely returning true and false constants. Also checks for ternary expressions where both expressions are the same constant or variable.

Rule.name: UnusedImport
Rule.Description: Imports for a class that is never referenced within the source file is unnecessary.

Rule.name: UnusedPrivateField
Rule.Description: Checks for private fields that are not referenced within the same class.

Rule.name: UnusedPrivateMethod
Rule.Description: Checks for private methods that are not referenced within the same class.

Rule.name: UnusedVariable
Rule.Description: Checks for variables that are never referenced.
